molecular.core.Trajectory¶

class molecular.core.Trajectory(data=None, coordinates=None, box=None, topology=None)[source]¶

Trajectory stores instantaneous data for a Topology, i.e., atomic coordinates, box information, velocity, etc.

data:

  • structure_id

  • atom_id

  • x

  • y

  • z

  • vx

  • vy

  • vz

  • fx

  • fy

  • fz

  • alpha

  • beta

  • user

config

  • structure_id

  • bx

  • by

  • bz

Methods:

__init__(data=None, coordinates=None, box=None, topology=None)[source]¶
Parameters

  • data (pandas.DataFrame) – (Optional) Structured information about Trajectory. Columns must include “structure_id”, “atom_id”, “x”, “y”, and “z”.

  • coordinates –

  • box –

  • topology (Topology) – (Optional) Topology that includes information about atoms.

property atom_ids: numpy.ndarray¶

Get unique atom IDs in the Trajectory.

Returns

Array of atom IDs.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

center(weights=None)[source]¶

Compute the center m of Trajectory a.

\[m = \frac{\sum_{i=1}^N w_i (x_i + y_i + z_i)} {\sum_{i=1}^N w_i}\]

Here, \(w_i\) refers to weights applied to individual atoms \(i\).

Parameters

weights (array-like) – (Optional) Weights for atoms in the trajectory. Follows the definition from numpy.average.

Returns

Center of each structure in the Trajectory.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

property columns¶

returns: :rtype: numpy.ndarray

property coordinates¶

Get Cartesian coordinates from the Trajectory.

Returns

Trajectory Cartesian coordinates.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

move(by=None, to=None, inplace=True)[source]¶

Move Trajectory a either by a constant or to a location. The two arguments by and to cannot be set simultaneously.

Parameters

  • by (array-like) – (Optional) Move a by a constant.

  • to (array-like) – (Optional) Move a to a location.

  • inplace (bool) – Should we perform the translation on a copy of the Trajectory (Default: False)

Returns

If return_copy is set, we return the moved Trajectory.

Return type

None or molecular.Trajectory

query(expr, only_index=False)[source]¶

Query the set Topology and return matching indices

Parameters

  • expr (str) – Selection text. See pandas.DataFrame.query

  • only_index (bool) – Should the entire Trajectory be returned, or only the array of indices?

Returns

Array of indices or Trajectory containing only expr.

Return type

numpy.ndarray or Trajectory

to_center(weights=None, inplace=False)[source]¶

Recenter all structures in the Trajectory around the origin.

Parameters

  • weights (numpy.ndarray) – (Optional) Weights for atoms in the trajectory. Follows the definition from numpy.average.

  • inplace (bool) – Make the change in place? (Default: False)
